questions.question: The eruption of the volcano is an ……………………… sight.
It was an ……………………… movie. I shouldn’t have watched it.
questions.description: Awful means bad, dreadful or terrible.

questions.question: He never took a ………………………. glance.
questions.description: Backward can be an adjective and an adverb. Backwards is an adverb.

questions.question: Bacteria ………………………. in the air we breathe and the food we eat.
questions.description: Bacteria is a plural noun and should take a plural verb.

questions.question: I feel …………………….. enough to go to the hospital.
questions.description: When a person feels ill, he feels bad.

questions.question: Don’t feel ………………………… about losing the match.
questions.description: When you feel sorry about something, you feel bad about it.

questions.question: The student was admonished for behaving ………………………. in the class.
questions.description: Badly means improperly. It is an adverb and modifies the verb behaving.

questions.question: Customs officers examined all ………………………. at the airport.
questions.description: Baggage is an uncountable noun. It does not have a plural form.

questions.question: We watched the fight with ………………………. breath.
questions.description: Bait is a lure. Bated means held in.

questions.question: When the rescuers found the castaway, he ………………………… alive.
questions.description: Barely means almost not. It has a negative force and hence you cannot use another negative word with it.

questions.question: She was so weak that she ....................................... hardly walk.
